recipe.ingredients: - dry brown lentils: 1 cup - water: 6 cups - olive oil: 2 tablespoons - onion (chopped): 1 medium - carrots (diced): 2 - celery stalks (diced): 2 - garlic cloves (minced): 3 - tomatoes (diced): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - spinach leaves: 4 cups - dried thyme: 1 teaspoon - dried basil: 1 teaspoon - salt: 1/2 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prep Lentils: Rinse the lentils under cold water and set aside. 2. Sauté Veggies: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5-8 minutes. 3. Cook Soup: Add the rinsed lentils, 6 cups of water, and diced tomatoes to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 20 minutes. 4. Add Greens and Seasonings: Stir in the spinach leaves, thyme, basil, salt, and black pepper. Continue to simmer for another 10 minutes, or until the lentils are fully cooked. 5. Serve: Check seasoning, adding more salt or pepper if needed. Serve hot.
